articles.title: CX Briefing: Beijing Warns of ‘Stablecoin' Fraud
articles.summary: Beijing and Shenzhen issued warnings this week about fundraising scams using new concepts such as 'stablecoins.' Stablecoins are a type of cryptocurrency designed to maintain a stable value by being pegged to a reserve asset. There are calls for China to develop a yuan-pegged stablecoin in Hong Kong.

articles.title: FTX Bahamas: $290m claims unpaid on KYC
articles.author: NEIL HARTNELL
articles.summary: FTX's Bahamian subsidiary has yet to pay some $290m in previously-approved creditor claims. This is because it has not been supplied with the necessary Know Your Customer (KYC) verification. The liquidators worked to pay smaller claims worth $50,000 and under first. Now they are working their way through approving and verifying the larger institutional claims and creditors.
